H0.text: The mass of the sodium atom increases during the process in which an electron is transferred from a sodium atom to a chlorine atom to form a bond.

H1.text: The sodium atom becomes an isotope when it transfers an electron to a chlorine atom during bond formation.

H2.text: The atomic number decreases when a sodium atom transfers its electron to a chlorine atom to form a bond.

H3.text: The sodium atom becomes a positive ion when an electron is transferred to a chlorine atom to form the bond.

A4.text: Sodium usually forms ionic compounds involving the Na+ cation.
